DataElement.preferredName: Health Information National Trends Survey Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Unique name for the survey. HINTS collects nationally representative data about the US public's use of cancer-related information. HINTS provides updates on changing patterns, needs, and information opportuniites in health; identifies changing health communications trends and practices; asesses cancer information access and usage; provides information about how cancer risks are perceived; and offers a test-bed to researchers to investigate new theories in health communication. HINTS data collection is conducted every 2-3 years.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Health Information National Trends Survey Name
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A survey designed to collect nationally representative data routinely about the American public's use of cancer-related information. The survey provides updates on changing patterns, needs, and information opportunities in health, identifies changing communications trends and practices, assesses cancer information access and usage, provides information about how cancer risks are perceived, and offers a testbed to researchers to test new theories in health communication._The words or language units by which a thing is known.
